column4: I am new to linux, but not so new to Sun/Unix.  Trying to install flash on Ubuntu 64-bit.  Flash seems to be only in the x86 variety..  Anyone know what I can do alternatively?
/msg ubotu chroot   only solution i know
This sets up a virtual 32-bit environment to install in right?
There does not seem to be a way to set up a feisty 32-bit type.  Still looking though...  <sigh>
